alert.note: Alert for Cannon; De Kalb; Rutherford; Smith; Trousdale; Warren; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 2:56PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Smith, De Kalb, east central Rutherford, northwestern Warren, Wilson, south central Trousdale and Cannon Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 255 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lebanon to near Woodbury to Centertown. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Smithville, Woodbury, Carthage, Hartsville, Watertown, Gordonsville, Hickman, South Carthage, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Auburntown, Centertown, Tuckers Crossroads, Dickerson Chapel Recreation Area, Cedars Of Lebanon State Park, Center Hill Lake, Edgar Evans State Park and Milton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 235 and 265. Interstate 840 between mile markers 68 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cannon; De Kalb; Rutherford; Smith; Trousdale; Warren; Wilson
